page.title: 01 ROSSENDALE
page.content: Our area of Rossendale is made up of a string of settlements dotted along the valley of the{River Irwell.}The main town of {Rawtenstall (pop.approx.30 000)is in the the west of the valley while to the east are the suburts of Newchurch and Cloughold .These in turn merge into the small town of Waterfoot to the east of our area. The countryside is of high moors{(Cowpe Hill 439m)}with the main routes in the valley bottom. The decline of the local{shoe/slipper industry,along with the opening of a motorway link{(M66)}south,has seen Rawtenstall become a dormitory of Manchester.This commuter population has been the cause of a large private house building programme.With goverment assisted 'Enterprize Zone' status the valley has seen some growth in small businesses.
